availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Rogers Underwood (Warren County State Representative and Senator)

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Goochland County, Virginia, native. Barren County, Kentucky, resident in 1803. Graduated from Transylvania College in, Lexington, Kentucky, in 1811. Lieutenant in 13th Kentucky Infantry Regiment during the War of 1812. Admitted to the bar in 1813. Practiced law in Glasgow, Kentucky. Glasgow town trustee and county auditor until 1823. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1816-1819. Bowling Green resident in 1823. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1825-1826. Unsuccessful candidate for lieutenant governor of Kentucky in 1828. Judge of the Kentucky Court of Appeals from 1828 to 1835. Whig member of the House of Representatives of the United States from March 4, 1835 to March 3, 1843. Whig Presidential elector in 1844. Speaker of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1846. Whig member of the Senate of the United States from March 4, 1847 to March 3, 1853. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1861 to 1863.

bibl.p: Biographical Dictionary of the United States Congress, 1774-Present, http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=U000011 (accessed May 4, 2017).
